title: Mairwa (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Mairwa (Vidhan Sabha constituency) was an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Siwan%20district">Siwan district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="Bihar">Bihar</a>. It was reserved for <a href="Scheduled%20castes%20and%20scheduled%20tribes">scheduled castes</a>.
Overview.
It was part of <a href="Siwan%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Siwan (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
As a consequence of the orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission of India</a>, Mairwa (Vidhan Sabha constituency) ceased to exist in 2010.
Election results.
1977-2005.
In the <a href="Bihar%20Assembly%20Election%2C%20Oct%202005">October 2005 state assembly elections</a>, Ramayan Manjhi of <a href="Bharatiya%20Janata%20Party">BJP</a> won the Mairwa (SC) assembly seat defeating his nearest rival Satyadeo Ram of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist-Leninist%29%20Liberation">CPI(M-L)L</a>. Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. Satyadeo Ram of CPI(M-L)L defeated Shiv Kumar Manjhi of RJD in <a href="Bihar%20Assembly%20Election%2C%20Feb%202005">February 2005</a>, Gorakh Ram of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> in 2000 and Giridhari Ram of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist%29">CPI(M)</a> in 1995. Gorakh Ram of Congress defeated Giridhari Ram of CPI(M) in 1990 and Independent in 1985. Ram Narain Ram of Congress defeated Giridhari Ram of CPI(M) in 1980. Phul Chand Ram of <a href="Janata%20Party">JP</a> defeated Ram Narain Ram of Congress in 1977.
